DOC.brief_summary: Projections NHANES III indicate approximately 12,000,000 U.S. adult â‰¥ 60 year age vitamin D insufficiency ( serum 25 ( OH ) D < 50 nmol/L ) . A grow body evidence suggest vitamin D status may important biologic process involved maintenance physical function . To test hypothesis vitamin D insufficiency associate poor muscle strength physical performance , propose evaluate role vitamin D status ( serum 25 ( OH ) D ) physical function fall CHS All Stars cohort , population advance age . The specific aim follow : Specific Aim 1 . To describe prevalence correlate vitamin D insufficiency adult advance age . Specific Aim 2 . To examine cross-sectional association vitamin D status muscle strength ( leg grip strength ) , physical performance ( 3 m/15 ft walk time , repeat chair stand , stand balance ) , self-reported physical function ( mobility , ADL IADL disability ) , fall . Specific Aim 3 . To examine longitudinal association vitamin D status baseline incident disability ( mobility , ADL IADL disability ) 3 year follow-up . Research Hypotheses : Low vitamin D status ( 25 ( OH ) D < 50 nmol/L ) associate ( ) low level muscle strength physical performance ; ( b ) high level self-reported limitation physical function fall ; ( c ) great odds incident disability .
DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D Physical Function Older Adults
DOC.criteria: Participant main CHS study Not willing give consent
